intro: [WRONG START] Populus arborea, commonly known as the poplar tree. It is a deciduous tree belonging to the Salicaceae family, characterized by its smooth, gray bark and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that appear in the spring, followed by winged seeds dispersed by the wind. Populus arborea is often found in moist soils near rivers and lakes, thriving in temperate climates. Its rapid growth rate makes it an important species in reforestation and ecological restoration projects.
